page.title: 09 FESTIVALS IN SOUTH-AYR
page.content: The Burns' Festival is held every year at the beginning of June. It lasts for one week. It is held in memory of our national poet{Robert } {Burns}who was born in Alloway in 1759. One of the most popular attractions of the festival is the{Tam o'Shanter {Ride.}This is to commemorate the famous ride from the Tam o' Shanter Inn, Ayr to the Brig o' Doon, Alloway. It is a re-enactment of the famous Burns' poem Tam o' Shanter. There are also debates, tours and exhibitions for the serious students of Robert Burns. There are folk evenings and ceilidhs and competitions - singing, reciting, painting - widely supported by local schools. The last event is{The Holy Fair}in Rozelle Park with many side shows and other entertainment.
